scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. [Monica] and [Bob] exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You then acknowledged the team's feelings and opened the floor for discussion. Now, Monica sighs and says, 'Even if we discuss our concerns, the time isn't going to magically expand.' Bob, rubbing his temples, mutters, 'This is just going to be a disaster waiting to happen.' You showed understanding of the team's feelings and proposed a practical solution, suggesting to prioritize the most critical tasks. Monica, however, appears skeptical and asks, 'But what if even the critical tasks can't be completed on time?' Bob, leaning back in his chair, adds, 'We might seriously need to consider abandoning some tasks altogether.' You empathized with the team's concerns and proposed delegating tasks or bringing in additional resources. Monica, still unconvinced, says, 'Even with delegation, how do we ensure everyone is working effectively?'
scenes.description: Bob, tapping his pen on the table, adds, 'We need a foolproof plan or this is just going to blow up in our faces.'

options.text: I understand your concern. Let's outline a clear plan with defined roles and responsibilities to ensure everyone knows what they're doing.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's concerns and proposed a practical solution with clear roles and responsibilities, showing high empathy and good social skills.

options.text: I know it's challenging, but we need to trust each other and our abilities. Let's focus on our strengths and tackle this head-on.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to trust in their abilities and focus on their strengths, demonstrating good self-regulation and motivation.

options.text: If anyone has any doubts or concerns about their tasks, now's the time to voice them. Otherwise, let's move forward and get this done.
options.analysis: You opened the floor for any remaining concerns but also pushed the team to move forward, showing moderate emotion perception and self-regulation.
